alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 6:48AM PST until November 05 at 5:02PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain yesterday has pushed the Skokomish River above flood stage. It will continue to recede through the day today, but another round of rain later today may keep the river above or near flood stage through Monday. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including Potlatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM PST Sunday, the stage was 16.7 feet. - Action stage is 15.0 feet - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM Sunday was was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue to recede today, but additional rainfall will then maintain the river at or near flood stage through Monday. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 11/23/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 400 PM PST.
